Events that occurred on 25 June.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1926 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to W.G. Harding.
1937 - Author Timothy J. Wheeler is born.
1957 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 200.
1963 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 245.
1989 – The first meeting of members of the Elvish Linguistic Fellowship takes place at the residence of Bill Welden.
2001 - Actress Pauline Letts dies.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 3019:
Aragorn II finds the sapling of the White Tree.[1][note 1]

content.title: Notes
content.content: ↑ There is an apparent inconsistency in dates: the chapter The Steward and the King states that "when the month of June entered in [the sapling] was laden with blossom", suggesting here that Aragorn had found and planted it before June began.

content.title: References
content.content: ↑ J.R.R. Tolkien, The Lord of the Rings, Appendix B, "The Chief Days from the Fall of Barad-dûr to the End of the Third Age"
